title: More Links for March 2014
summary:
Key ideas
- Fecal transplants now available in pill form.
- Pro-Israel American Jewish groups oppose legislative attempt to penalize boycotting of Israel due to free speech issues.
- Other forms of charity may be more effective than GiveDirectly-style cash transfers.
- Test preparation for the SAT is not as effective as commonly believed, and arguments for changes to the SAT are wrong.
- People tend to have an "overconfidence bias" when it comes to their first marriage lasting forever.
- Decentralized bitcoin prediction markets are a new technology with potential.
- Surgical checklists may not have much of an effect on patient outcomes.
- Unused government buildings cost the government billions in maintenance because they won't sell them due to regulations.
- The army's top official in charge of prosecuting sexual assault was accused of sexual assault at a conference about sexual assault.
- Saturated fat may not be linked to heart disease, according to a recent study.
- NPR provides a list of what jobs are most likely to cause people to earn more or less than their parents did.
- The effect of severe pathogen stress on society.
- Debating unimportant issues can waste time and resources.

Key learnings
- Charity other than GiveDirectly-style cash transfers may be more effective.
- Test preparation for the SAT is not as helpful as commonly believed.
- People tend to be overconfident in the success of their first marriage.
- There are potential issues with using surgical checklists.
- Unused government buildings cost the government a lot of money.
- Sexual assault is an issue in the military.
- Saturated fat may not be as linked to heart disease as previously thought.
- There are certain jobs that are more likely to cause people to earn more or less than their parents did.
- Severe pathogen stress can have a significant effect on social structures.
- Debating unimportant issues can be a distraction from more pressing concerns.

Key questions
- Why aren't other effective forms of charity utilized more frequently?
- How can we ensure that test preparation for the SAT is more effective?
- Why do people tend to be overconfident in the success of their first marriage?
- How can surgical checklists be improved to be more effective?
- Why won't the government sell unused buildings?
- Why is sexual assault an issue in the military?
- How can we determine the true effects of saturated fat on heart disease?
- What are the factors that contribute to a job causing people to earn more or less than their parents did?
- What other effects does severe pathogen stress have on society?
- How can we avoid wasting time and resources debating unimportant issues?
